page.title: 05Weeton Primary School
page.content: Weeton Church of England primary school was founded in the 1840s; but the present building dates from 1886. Its centenary is to be celebrated in September 1986. The school was{threatened with {closure}in l979; but it was saved by a well-organised campaign, fully supported by the local community. There are 29 pupils, one full- time and two part-time teachers. In l984, over Â£850 was raised by the {Parent-Teachers-Friends Association}to buy equipment for the school. An extension, built by volunteers, opened in l978. The school has{close ties with {the community.}A play group meets on the premises and parish council meetings are held there.
